cluster_relations.rel_desc: Female butterflies deposit their eggs on specific host plants.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Plant Structures as Lepidopteran Substrate and Background

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: during the egg stage of the life cycle
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: FunctionalReason: host plants will provide food for emerging larvae

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The adult stage of butterflies is characterized by reproductive activity.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a female organism deposits its eggs on a specific substrate or host.
args.justification: The relation links female butterflies to host plants with the reproductive action of depositing eggs; a concise and reusable predicate for this behavior is 'oviposits_on'.
args.remark: Chosen over 'lays_eggs_on' for more general biological applicability across taxa.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life stage or entity is defined or typified by a particular behavior.
args.justification: The relation states that the adult stage of butterflies is characterized by reproductive activity; this is best modeled as the life stage having a characteristic behavior.
The predicate 'oviposits_on' is a specific reproductive behavior linking an organism to an oviposition substrate, fitting a reproductive behavior relation class.
This relation characterizes a life stage by a behavior (reproduction), which is a generic pattern of describing an entity in terms of its typical behaviors.
The relation describes an action performed by an agent (female butterflies) on a target (host plants), which fits an action/agency-oriented group.
The relation states that the adult life stage is characterized by (has) the attribute of reproductive behavior, fitting an attribute/characterization dimension.
